definition: A set of written sheets of skin or paper or tablets of wood or ivory
sentence: I'm reading a new book on history.

definition: A hinged, sliding, or revolving barrier at the entrance to a building, room, or vehicle, or in the framework of a cupboard
sentence: She walked through the door.

definition: Moisture condensed from the atmosphere that falls visibly in separate drops
sentence: We need an umbrella for the rain.

definition: A woody perennial plant, typically having a single stem or trunk growing to a considerable height and bearing lateral branches at some distance from the ground
sentence: The tree has beautiful flowers.

definition: A warm-blooded egg-laying vertebrate distinguished by the possession of feathers, wings, and a beak and (typically) by being able to fly
sentence: The bird sang a lovely tune.

definition: A domesticated carnivorous mammal that typically has a long snout, an acute sense of smell, and a barking, howling, or whining voice
sentence: The dog barked at the stranger.

definition: A small domesticated carnivorous mammal with soft fur, a short snout, and retractable claws
sentence: The cat sat on the mat."

definition: A limbless cold-blooded vertebrate animal with gills and fins living wholly in water
sentence: I have a gold fish in my aquarium.

definition: A naturally raised area of land, not as high or craggy as a mountain
sentence: The house is on top of the hill.

definition: The natural satellite of the earth, visible (chiefly at night) by reflected light from the sun
sentence: The moon shines brightly at night.

definition: A fixed luminous point in the night sky which is a large, remote incandescent body like the sun
sentence: I saw a shooting star last night.

definition: The star around which the earth orbits and provides light and warmth
sentence: The sun rises in the east.

definition: Push oneself off a surface and into the air by using the muscles in one's legs and feet
sentence: The kids like to jump on the trampoline.

definition: Move at a speed faster than a walk
sentence: I run every morning for exercise.

definition: Make musical sounds with the voice, especially words with a set tune
sentence: She loves to sing in the shower.

definition: A color between green and violet, seen in the clear sky at midday
sentence: The sky is blue today.

definition: A color at the end opposite that of violet, as of blood, fire, or rubies
sentence: I love red roses.

definition: Of great or more than average height, especially (with reference to an object) relative to width
sentence: He is the tallest person in the room.

definition: Measuring a small distance from end to end
sentence: I took a short nap in the afternoon.

definition: A white liquid produced by the mammary glands of mammals
sentence: I drink milk every morning.

definition: Engage in activity for enjoyment and recreation rather than a serious or practical purpose
sentence: The children play in the park.

definition: Moving or capable of moving at high speed
sentence: He runs very fast.

definition: Moving or operating, or designed to do so, only at a low speed; not quick or fast
sentence: The tortoise is slow but steady.

definition: Having a high degree of heat or a high temperature
sentence: The tea is too hot to drink.

definition: Of or at a low or relatively low temperature, especially when compared with the human body
sentence: I caught a cold last week.

definition: A feeling of great pleasure and happiness
sentence: The news brought her great joy.

definition: Feeling or showing sorrow; unhappy
sentence: The movie made me feel sad.

definition: Feeling or showing pleasure or contentment
sentence: Today is a happy day.

definition: Solid, firm, and rigid; not easily broken, bent, or pierced
sentence: The math problem was too hard.

definition: Easy to mold, cut, compress, or fold; not hard or firm to the touch
sentence: The pillow is very soft.

definition: An instrument for writing or drawing with ink, typically consisting of a metal nib or ball, or a nylon tip, fitted into a metal or plastic holder
sentence: I need a pen to write a letter.

definition: A piece of furniture with a flat or sloped surface and typically with drawers, at which one can read, write, or do other work
sentence: My computer is on the desk.

definition: A covering for the foot, typically made of leather, having a sturdy sole and not reaching above the ankle
sentence: I bought a new pair of shoes.

definition: A colorless, transparent, odorless liquid that forms the seas, lakes, rivers, and rain and is the basis of the fluids of living organisms
sentence: I drink eight glasses of water a day.

definition: The expanse of air over the earth's surface
sentence: The sky is clear tonight.

definition: A large natural stream of water flowing in a channel to the sea, a lake, or another river
sentence: The river flows through the city.

definition: A large natural elevation of the earth's surface rising abruptly from the surrounding level; a large steep hill
sentence: We climbed to the top of the mountain.

definition: A separate seat for one person, typically with a back and four legs
sentence: Please have a seat on that chair.

definition: Food made of flour, water, and yeast or another leavening agent, mixed together and baked
sentence: She bakes fresh bread every morning.

definition: An opening in a wall or screen through which customers are served in a bank, ticket office, or similar building
sentence: Open the window to let in fresh air.

definition: A road vehicle, typically with four wheels, powered by an internal combustion engine or electric motor and able to carry a small number of people
sentence: We drove the car to the beach.

definition: A wide way leading from one place to another, especially one with a specially prepared surface that vehicles can use
sentence: The road is under construction.

definition: A mechanical or electrical device for measuring time, indicating hours, minutes, and sometimes seconds by hands on a round dial or by displayed figures
sentence: The clock strikes midnight.

definition: A round object that can be thrown, kicked, or hit in a game
sentence: The kids played catch with a ball.

definition: A form of competitive activity or sport played according to rules
sentence: We played a board game last night.

definition: A small vessel propelled on water by oars, sails, or an engine
sentence: They sailed around the world in a boat.

definition: A shaped covering for the head worn for warmth, as a fashion item, or as part of a uniform
sentence: He wears a hat to shield from the sun.

definition: A flexible container with an opening at the top, used for carrying things
sentence: She carries a bag with her books.

definition: Any of the fine threadlike strands growing from the skin of humans, mammals, and some other animals
sentence: She brushed her long hair.

definition: A sweet food made with a mixture of flour, eggs, fat, and sugar, baked and sometimes iced or decorated
sentence: It's a chocolate cake for dessert.

definition: The opening in the lower part of the human face, surrounded by the lips, through which food is taken in and vocal sounds are emitted
sentence: She opened her mouth to speak.

definition: Each of a pair of globular organs in the head through which people and vertebrate animals see
sentence: His eyes are blue.

definition: The organ of hearing and balance in humans and other vertebrates, especially the external part of this
sentence: She has an earring in her left ear.

definition: The end part of a person's arm beyond the wrist, including the palm, fingers, and thumb
sentence: He held the baby's hand.

definition: The lower extremity of the leg below the ankle, on which a person stands or walks
sentence: My foot hurts after the long walk.

definition: An institution for educating children
sentence: Kids go to school to learn.

definition: A person whom one knows and has a bond of mutual affection with, typically exclusive of sexual or family relations
sentence: She is my best friend.

definition: A building for human habitation, especially one that consists of a ground floor and one or more upper storeys
sentence: We bought a new house.

definition: Of the color between blue and yellow in the spectrum; colored like grass
sentence: The grass is always green in spring.

definition: Of the color between green and orange in the spectrum, a primary subtractive color complementary to blue; colored like ripe lemons or egg yolks
sentence: She wore a bright yellow dress.

definition: Mark (letters, words, or other symbols) on a surface, typically paper, with a pen, pencil, or similar implement
sentence: I write in my journal every night.

definition: Look at and comprehend the meaning of (written or printed matter) by interpreting the characters or symbols of which it is composed
sentence: I read a book every week.

definition: Move at a regular and fairly slow pace by lifting and setting down each foot in turn, never having both feet off the ground at once
sentence: We walk in the park every evening.

definition: Propel the body through water by using the limbs, or (in the case of fish or tail-propelled sea mammals) by a sinuous movement of the body
sentence: I love to swim in the ocean.

definition: Move rhythmically to music, typically following a set sequence of steps
sentence: They dance beautifully.

definition: Make the spontaneous sounds and movements of the face and body that are the instinctive expressions of lively amusement and sometimes also of derision
sentence: He made everyone laugh.

definition: Shed tears in distress, pain, or sorrow
sentence: The baby will cry if she's hungry.

definition: The round fruit of a tree of the rose family, which typically has thin green or red skin and crisp flesh
sentence: I eat an apple every day.

definition: A round juicy citrus fruit with a tough bright reddish-yellow rind
sentence: He peeled the orange.

definition: A berry, typically green (classified as white), purple, red, or black, growing in clusters on a grapevine, eaten as fruit, and used in making wine
sentence: She loves eating grapes.

definition: A long curved fruit which grows in clusters and has soft pulpy flesh and yellow skin when ripe
sentence: The banana is ripe and ready to eat.

definition: A large heavy mammal with thick fur and sharp claws which can stand on two legs like a person
sentence: The bear is a powerful animal.

definition: A large tawny-colored cat that lives in prides, found in Africa and northwestern India
sentence: The lion is called the king of the jungle.

definition: A large mammal with a trunk, long tusks, and large ears, native to Africa and southern Asia. It is the largest living land animal
sentence: The elephant has a long trunk.

definition: A small to medium-sized primate that typically has a long tail, most kinds of which live in trees in tropical countries
sentence: The monkey climbed the tree.

definition: An African wild horse with black-and-white stripes and an erect mane
sentence: The zebra has black and white stripes.

definition: A large plant-eating marsupial with a long powerful tail and strongly developed hind limbs that enable it to leap great distances, native to Australia
sentence: The kangaroo jumps very high.

definition: A large African mammal with a very long neck and forelegs, having a coat patterned with brown patches separated by lighter lines. It is the tallest living animal
sentence: The giraffe has a long neck.

definition: A very large solitary cat with a yellow-brown coat striped with black, native to the forests of Asia but becoming increasingly rare
sentence: The tiger prowls in the jungle.

definition: A flattened structure of a higher plant, typically green and blade-like, that is attached to a stem directly or via a stalk. Leaves are the main organs of photosynthesis and transpiration
sentence: The leaf fell from the tree.

definition: A tailless amphibian with a short squat body, moist smooth skin, and very long hind legs for leaping
sentence: The frog jumped into the pond.

definition: A waterbird with a broad flat bill, short legs, webbed feet, and a waddling gait
sentence: The duck swam in the lake.

definition: A garment for the upper part of the body, typically made of cotton or a similar fabric
sentence: He wore a blue shirt today.

definition: An instrument for writing or drawing, consisting of a thin stick of graphite or a similar substance enclosed in a long thin piece of wood or fixed in a metal or plastic case
sentence: She sharpened her pencil.

definition: A flat length of wood or rigid material, attached to a wall or forming part of a piece of furniture, that provides a surface for the storage or display of objects
sentence: Place the book on the shelf.

definition: A pebbly or sandy shore, especially by the sea between high- and low-water marks
sentence: We spent the day at the beach.

definition: A visible mass of condensed water vapor floating in the atmosphere, typically high above the ground
sentence: The sky is filled with clouds.

definition: A small piece of rock found on the ground
sentence: I skipped a stone across the pond.

definition: Material manufactured in thin sheets from the pulp of wood or other fibrous substances, used for writing, drawing, or printing on, or as wrapping material
sentence: I need a sheet of paper to write a note.

definition: A piece of furniture with a flat top and one or more legs, providing a level surface for eating, writing, or working at
sentence: The vase is on the table.

definition: The seed-bearing part of a plant, consisting of reproductive organs (stamens and carpels) that are typically surrounded by a brightly colored corolla (petals) and a green calyx (sepals)
sentence: The flower smells lovely.

definition: A warm-blooded egg-laying vertebrate distinguished by the possession of feathers, wings, and a beak and (typically) by being able to fly
sentence: The bird sang a sweet song.

definition: A small insect
sentence: There's a bug on the wall.

definition: Vegetation consisting of typically short plants with long narrow leaves, growing wild or cultivated on lawns and pasture, and as a fodder crop
sentence: The grass is green and lush.

definition: Atmospheric water vapor frozen into ice crystals and falling in light white flakes or lying on the ground as a white layer
sentence: The snow is falling heavily.

definition: Moisture condensed from the atmosphere that falls visibly in separate drops
sentence: The rain poured all day.

definition: The perceptible natural movement of the air, especially in the form of a current of air blowing from a particular direction
sentence: The wind blew the leaves around.

definition: A violent disturbance of the atmosphere with strong winds and usually rain, thunder, lightning, or snow
sentence: The storm lasted for hours.

definition: The sound caused by the rapid expansion of air along an electrical strike
sentence: The thunder was loud and startling.

definition: The occurrence of a natural electrical discharge of very short duration and high voltage between a cloud and the ground or within a cloud, accompanied by a bright flash and typically also thunder
sentence: The lightning lit up the night sky.
